title: The United States claims that ‘conflict in space is not inevitable’
content:
In 1996, Joseph W. Ashy, former U.S. commander-in-chief of the North American Aerospace Defense Command, famously said: “We’re going to fight in space. We’re going to fight from space and we’re going to fight into space.” In less than three decades since then, we’ve seen the establishment of the U.S. Space Force, anti-satellite weapons testing by major spacefaring nations and the rapid development of weapons that can interfere with, disrupt or destroy space assets. No wonder there are many concerns about the potential of war in space. But the belief in the inevitability of space becoming the next major battlefield…

description: On April 18, the U.S. Vice-President committed the United States to “not conduct destructive direct-ascent anti-satellite missile testing.”
